title: Ruby Rose Undergoes Emergency Surgery After Severe Batwoman Injuries
text:
Photo: Rodin_Eckenroth/FilmMagic

Months into filming her new Batwoman series for the CW, Ruby Rose revealed the show’s production was temporarily halted as she underwent emergency surgery for on-set injuries. Per a social media post, Rose wrote that the injuries occurred earlier this year, which accounted for a “new Pez dispenser scar” on her neck. “I was told I needed an emergency surgery or I was risking becoming paralyzed,” she explained. “I had herniated two discs doing stunts, and they were close to severing my spinal chord. I was in chronic pain and yet couldn’t feel my arms.” Rose also included a video of her (pretty graphic) surgery on Instagram and thanked her doctors for a smooth procedure. “Did you not watch that Grey’s Anatomy episode where they left a towel in a patient?” she joked about the video. “Also I wanted to see what happens when we go under.”

With Batwoman, Rose made history by becoming the first openly lesbian superhero on television. The show is debuting on October 6.
description: Ruby Rose revealed she sustained a serious facial injury while filming the CW’s Batwoman, which left her with permanent damage.
